intro: Hieracium lanseanum subsp. reboudianum, commonly known as the Corsican hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and bright yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky slopes and grasslands. It has a taproot system and produces achenes with pappus for wind dispersal. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of alpine and subalpine vegetation.
